title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A landmark novel that tells the multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that follows Winston Smith in a totalitarian superstate.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A masterful satire of social class and marriage in 19th century England, following the Bennet family and their five daughters.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of teenage alienation and loss of innocence in the post-war world through the eyes of Holden Caulfield.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A mystical story about following one's dreams and finding one's destiny, following a young Andalusian shepherd.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A haunting story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of modern Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A philosophical novel about a man who remains eternally young while his portrait ages, exploring themes of hedonism and morality.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a genetically engineered future where society is divided into strict castes and happiness is chemically induced.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The riveting first-person narrative of a young man who grows to become the most notorious magician his world has ever seen.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A haunting American classic about a young woman's descent into mental illness parallel to her internship at a prominent magazine.

title: The Shadow of the Wind
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
description: A literary thriller set in post-war Barcelona about a young boy who discovers a mysterious book that changes his life.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A nostalgic story of loss and sexuality set against the backdrop of 1960s Tokyo student protests.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: An epic science fiction masterpiece about power, politics, and survival on a desert planet that holds the key to the galaxy's future.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a theocratic society where women have lost all their rights and are valued only for reproduction.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and then never speaks another word.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son's journey through a post-apocalyptic America, fighting for survival while keeping their humanity.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: The story of a traveling salesman who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A story narrated by Death about a young girl in Nazi Germany who steals books and shares them with others.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A story about an ordinary man who becomes entangled in a senseless murder on an Algerian beach.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A surreal story about a man's search for his missing wife that turns into a psychic journey through Japan's dark history.

title: The Master and Margarita
author: Mikhail Bulgakov
description: A satirical tale of the Devil's visit to Soviet Moscow, interweaving a love story with a retelling of the Crucifixion.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: An epic tale of revenge and redemption following a wrongfully imprisoned man who orchestrates an elaborate plan for vengeance.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about a hobbit who joins a quest to reclaim a dwarf kingdom from a fearsome dragon.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel about a poor student who commits murder and then deals with the psychological consequences.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, a young woman fights for survival in a televised battle to the death.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: The ancient Greek epic poem following Odysseus's ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The story of a man who loses his sanity reading too many chivalric romances and decides to become a knight-errant.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel about a hobbit's quest to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord.

title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A surreal tale of a man arrested and prosecuted by a remote authority with no explanation for his crime.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Cixin Liu
description: A groundbreaking science fiction novel about humanity's first contact with an alien civilization.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem that describes Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A gripping crime novel about a journalist and a young computer hacker investigating a decades-old disappearance.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The writings of a young Jewish girl hiding from Nazi persecution during World War II.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that explores morality, free will, and the existence of God through the story of four brothers.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: A powerful story of resilience following an African American woman's life in early twentieth-century Georgia.

title: The Haunting of Hill House
author: Shirley Jackson
description: A chilling supernatural thriller about four seekers who arrive at a notoriously unfriendly mansion.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: An ancient Chinese military treatise that has influenced both military and business strategy.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: The ancient Greek epic poem about the Trojan War and the rage of Achilles.

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
description: A sweeping epic of good and evil, treachery and intrigue, violence and beauty in medieval England.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The first novel in Asimov's Foundation series about the decline and rebirth of a galactic empire.

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
description: A historical murder mystery set in an Italian monastery in the year 1327.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
author: Milan Kundera
description: A novel exploring the philosophical concept of eternal return through the lives of four interconnected characters.

title: The Road Less Traveled
author: M. Scott Peck
description: A groundbreaking self-help book combining psychological and spiritual insights.

title: The Tale of Genji
author: Murasaki Shikibu
description: The world's first novel, telling the story of the romantic life of a son of a Japanese emperor.

title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt
description: A psychological thriller about a group of classics students at an elite college who become entangled in murder.

title: The Remains of the Day
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: A butler reflects on his years of service and the sacrifices he made for his profession.

title: The Master of Go
author: Yasunari Kawabata
description: A novel based on a championship game of Go, exploring the clash between tradition and modernity.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
description: A young boy's life is transformed after surviving an accident that kills his mother and leads to his possession of a famous painting.

title: The Dispossessed
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A philosophical science fiction novel about two worlds with opposing political and social systems.

title: The Poisonwood Bible
author: Barbara Kingsolver
description: The story of an evangelical Baptist missionary who takes his family to the Belgian Congo in 1959.

title: The Bhagavad Gita
author: Anonymous
description: A 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the epic Mahabharata, containing spiritual and philosophical teachings.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction series following the adventures of Arthur Dent after Earth's destruction.

title: The Corrections
author: Jonathan Franzen
description: A satirical look at an American family trying to get together for one last Christmas.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: A stranded astronaut must use his ingenuity to survive alone on Mars.

title: The Tao Te Ching
author: Lao Tzu
description: A fundamental text for both philosophical and religious Taoism, and a strong influence on Buddhism and Confucianism.

title: The Blind Assassin
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A complex narrative involving a novel-within-a-novel, exploring themes of memory, loss, and family secrets.

title: The Sandman: Preludes & Nocturnes
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A groundbreaking graphic novel series following Dream of the Endless, who rules over the world of dreams.

title: The Aeneid
author: Virgil
description: The epic poem following Aeneas's journey from Troy to Italy to found what would become Rome.

title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
author: Malcolm X with Alex Haley
description: The personal account of Malcolm X's life and evolving philosophy of black pride, black nationalism, and pan-Africanism.

title: The Silmarillion
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The epic history of the First Age of Middle-earth, detailing the creation of the world and the great battles of the Elves.

title: The Stranger Beside Me
author: Ann Rule
description: A true crime account of serial killer Ted Bundy, written by a former colleague who knew him before his crimes were discovered.

title: The Federalist Papers
author: Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, John Jay
description: A collection of 85 articles and essays promoting the ratification of the United States Constitution.

title: The Mists of Avalon
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley
description: A retelling of the Arthurian legends from the perspectives of the women behind the throne.

title: The Gulag Archipelago
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
description: A comprehensive history of the Soviet Union's forced labor camp system, based on documents and survivor testimonies.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A groundbreaking science fiction novel exploring gender and society through the story of an envoy's mission to an androgynous world.

title: The Canterbury Tales
author: Geoffrey Chaucer
description: A collection of stories told by pilgrims on their way to Canterbury, providing a vivid portrait of medieval life.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a theocratic society where women have lost all their rights and are valued only for reproduction.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A story of passion, guilt, and redemption in Puritan New England, following a woman condemned for adultery.

title: The Quran
author: Anonymous
description: The central religious text of Islam, believed by Muslims to be a revelation from God.

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
description: A science fiction novel about a scientist who discovers how to make himself invisible but descends into madness.

title: The Decameron
author: Giovanni Boccaccio
description: A collection of 100 tales told by a group of young people sheltering from the Black Death in Florence.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: A landmark work in evolutionary biology that introduces the concept of genes as the primary unit of natural selection.

title: The Symposium
author: Plato
description: A philosophical text examining the nature of love through a series of speeches at an ancient Greek drinking party.

title: The Jungle
author: Upton Sinclair
description: A powerful exposé of the American meatpacking industry and the horrors of industrial capitalism.

title: The Waste Land
author: T.S. Eliot
description: A masterpiece of modernist poetry, depicting the decay of modern civilization through fragmented narratives.

title: The Prince
author: Niccolò Machiavelli
description: A seminal work of political philosophy examining the acquisition and maintenance of political power.

title: The Sound and the Fury
author: William Faulkner
description: A complex modernist novel following the decline of the Compson family through multiple narrative perspectives.

title: The Upanishads
author: Anonymous
description: Ancient Sanskrit texts that form the theoretical basis for the Hindu religion.

title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
author: Junot Díaz
description: A multi-generational story about a Dominican-American family and their curse, blending magical realism with nerd culture.

title: The Analects
author: Confucius
description: A collection of sayings and ideas attributed to Confucius, emphasizing personal and governmental morality.

title: The Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel about a washed-up hacker hired for one last job in a dystopian future.

title: The Satanic Verses
author: Salman Rushdie
description: A complex narrative blending magical realism with contemporary events, exploring themes of migration, identity, and faith.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: An existentialist novel about a French Algerian who commits a murder and faces the absurdity of life.

title: The Watchmen
author: Alan Moore
description: A groundbreaking graphic novel that deconstructs the superhero genre while exploring complex moral and philosophical themes.

title: The Mahabharata
author: Vyasa
description: One of the major Sanskrit epics of ancient India, following the Kurukshetra War and the fates of the Kaurava and Pandava princes.

title: The Republic
author: Plato
description: A foundational work of Western philosophy examining justice, the nature of the ideal state, and the role of the philosopher in society.

title: The Plague
author: Albert Camus
description: A story about a plague sweeping through a city in Algeria, exploring themes of solidarity and resistance in the face of absurdity.

title: The Histories
author: Herodotus
description: The founding work of history in Western literature, covering the Greco-Persian Wars and various ancient cultures.

title: The Waves
author: Virginia Woolf
description: An experimental novel following the lives of six friends through a series of interior monologues.

title: The Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: Personal writings of the Roman Emperor reflecting on life, duty, and the nature of the universe.

title: The Tin Drum
author: Günter Grass
description: A story of a boy who decides to stop growing at age three, told against the backdrop of Nazi Germany.

title: The Interpretation of Dreams
author: Sigmund Freud
description: A seminal work in the field of psychoanalysis, exploring the significance of dreams and their relation to the unconscious.

title: The Tale of the Heike
author: Anonymous
description: A classic work of Japanese literature depicting the struggle between two clans for control of Japan in the 12th century.

title: The Second Sex
author: Simone de Beauvoir
description: A groundbreaking work of feminist philosophy examining the treatment of women throughout history.

title: The Consolation of Philosophy
author: Boethius
description: A philosophical work written in prison, exploring the nature of fortune, happiness, and the divine.
